business.headline: Elon Musk becomes world's first person with $800 billion after SpaceX-xAI dealMusk is now $578 billion richer than Google co-founder Larry Page, the world's second-wealthiest person, who is estimated to be worth $281 billion.

Gold jumps nearly 4%, silver up 6%: Is the rally set to continue?At the time of writing, gold was priced at Rs 1,58,858, up 3.28% or Rs 5,049. Silver showed an even stronger recovery, trading at Rs 2,83,395, higher by 5.74% or Rs 15,380.

Sensex, Nifty end higher amid volatile trade; Infosys falls over 7%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 78.56 points higher at 83,817.69, while the NSE Nifty50 added 48.45 points to settle at 25,776. Most broader market indices also finished positive, even as intraday volatility spiked.

Infosys, TCS shares tumble amid global tech sell-off: Is the AI fear justified?Was today's slide in IT stocks a glimpse of the future or just market overreaction? For investors, the only question now is whether the AI threat is real or simply rattling nerves.

Why Hugo Boss sees India as a key growth market amid global slowdownHugo Boss currently has around 15 stores in India and plans to double that number over the next two to three years. According to its CEO, the brand is being well received by both men and women in the country.

Extended ITR deadline explained: Who can file till August 31 and who can'tFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified this during her Budget speech, saying that only specific taxpayers would get extra time, while most individuals would continue to follow the existing deadline.

Why banks are using IVR checks for high-value UPI paymentsOne of the most common safety steps used today is IVR verification, where banks confirm a transaction through an automated phone call before money is transferred.

Global tech sell-off hits Indian IT stocks: Could this trigger more layoffs?AI has started influencing how the IT industry works and hires. Understanding today's developments helps IT professionals see where the real opportunities are and what adjustments may be needed over time.

Deepinder Goyal calls ex-employees back to Zomato, says I want you backAccording to Goyal, the company already has more than 400 employees who are currently in their second or third stint with the group.

Why Anthropic's new AI tools rattled Wall Street's tech giants, hit Indian IT stocksThe slide in IT stocks is not just about prices. It reflects the new uncertainty AI brings to global tech. Knowing what sparked it helps decode what lies ahead for the sector.

How buying gold on an app is pushing real gold prices higherIt is not just safe haven demand or industrial demand alone driving gold and silver prices higher. A quiet shift in how people buy gold and silver is changing real-world supply and prices.
Infosys, TCS sink up to 8%: Why are IT stocks falling today?A fresh AI development in the US set off a chain reaction that landed right on Dalal Street. This story helps you make sense of the chaos.
Sensex, Nifty fall as IT stocks sink, Infosys tumbles over 6%At 9:21 am, the Sensex traded at 83,645.60, down 93.53 points, while the Nifty hovered at 25,718.50, slipping 9.05 points.

Trump's top economic adviser Stephen Miran resigns from White House roleStephen Miran has resigned as chair of the White House's Council of Economic Advisers to focus on his Federal Reserve role. The move follows Trump's nomination of Kevin Warsh to fill Miran's Fed Board seat, signalling shifts in economic leadership.

India set to keep some agriculture protections under US deal: Trump's trade chiefThe Trump administration is finalising the India trade deal, which will cut India's tariffs on US industrial goods from 13.5% to zero while allowing New Delhi to retain some protections on agricultural imports, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said.

Which products Americans are searching amid India-US trade dealIndian textiles, diamonds and jewellery dominate exports globally, but American interest appears to rest with a far smaller commodity, a tiny crustacean.

Sensex ends 2,000 points higher: Here's why the stock market jumped todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,072.67 points to close at 83,739.13, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 639.15 points to settle at 25,727.55. The Nifty recorded its best single-day gain since May 2025, showing a strong return of buying interest after recent weakness.

Gold and silver ETFs surge again after three-day slump. What changed today?Gold and silver may stay volatile in the near term, but today's bounce shows investors are still willing to buy dips. Whether the recovery holds will depend on global cues and key support levels.

Did you miss the India-US trade deal stock market rally? Here's what to doEarly signs of the rally were visible even before Indian markets opened. Gift Nifty jumped more than 700 points after the trade deal announcement, signalling a strong start for Dalal Street.

India–US trade deal and the big oil question: What's changing for India?India became one of the largest buyers of discounted Russian crude after 2022, a trend that helped reduce its import bill. US President Donald Trump's announcement indicates that these purchases will eventually decline, but the immediate impact is expected to be limited.

entertainment.headline: Ajay Devgn shares Shatak teaser, congratulates RSS on completing 100 years Actor Ajay Devgn shared the teaser of Shatak, a film that marks 100 years of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS). The film highlights RSS's role in nation-building and has set off social media reactions.

Varanasi director SS Rajamouli recalls James Cameron's advice on filmmaking Filmmaker SS Rajamouli opened up about the advice he received from Avatar director James Cameron. Slated for a 2027 release, the filmmaker's upcoming film Varanasi stars Mahesh Babu and Priyanka Chopra Jonas in lead roles.

Malaika Arora reacts to ex Arjun Kapoor's 'life's been cruel to me lately' post Malaika Arora, along with several Bollywood celebrities, reacted to Arjun Kapoor's heartfelt post on his mother's birth anniversary. The actor reflected on recent personal challenges in a message shared on social media.

Ram Charan's Peddi pushed to April as Pawan Kalyan's film takes over release slot Ram Charan's film Peddi, also starring Janhvi Kapoor, has been postponed for release in April this year. The film's original release date in March has now been taken over by Pawan Kalyan's upcoming film.

Assi trailer: Taapsee Pannu is a lawyer again in an Anubhav Sinha film after Mulk The trailer for Anubhav Sinha's Assi, featuring Taapsee Pannu as a relentless lawyer, dropped on February 4. The hard-hitting investigative drama also features Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub, Manoj Pahwa, Kumud Mishra, Kani Kusruti and Revathy in key roles.

Meryl Streep, Tom Cruise, George Clooney in K3G? Karan Johar reacts to AI casting A viral AI video reimagining Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham with Hollywood stars has attracted the attention of filmmaker Karan Johar, as he shares his reaction and hints at the possibility of a sequel to the popular Bollywood film.

Alia Bhatt to star in Housewife, Rajkummar Rao likely the male lead: Report Actor Alia Bhatt will reportedly join filmmaker Abhishek Pathak for a new relationship drama, titled Housewife. Actor Rajkummar Rao is being considered for the main male role.

Resul Pookutty recalls AR Rahman's 3.30 am call to introduce Hans Zimmer Oscar-winning sound engineer Resul Pookutty recounted an unexpected 3.30 am video call from AR Rahman, during which he was introduced to Hollywood composer Hans Zimmer while working on Nitesh Tiwari's Ramayana.

What did Mahesh Babu say on time travel angle in Rajamouli's Varanasi? Read here SS Rajamouli's Varanasi is among the most anticipated Indian films at the moment. Following the film's recent release date announcement, Mahesh Babu spoke on whether the film explores the concept of time travel as is being widely said.

The 50 Day 3 highlights: Arbaz's cheating irks all, Prince slams influencers The 50 turned chaotic on day 3 as Arbaz Patel faced cheating accusations during the card task. Meanwhile, Prince Narula and Yuvika Chaudhary sparked an actors-influencers clash with their sharp remarks.

Did Dhurandhar The Revenge really need a teaser if they had nothing new to show? Dhurandhar The Revenge teaser promised a grand event but ended up showcasing clips from the end credits of the first film. Didn't we deserve more peeks from the new film? Here's why giving audiences nothing new feels more upsetting than underwhelming.

Manoj Pahwa on Aryan Khan's The Bads of Bollywood: I had refused him at first Manoj Pahwa spoke about the challenges of filming Aryan Khan's debut series The Ba***ds of Bollywood. He also recalled how Aryan Khan pushed his creative limits in the show.

Do Deewane Seher Mein trailer: Siddhant-Mrunal explore imperfect, real love The trailer of Do Deewane Seher Mein offers a fresh take on romance. Starring Mrunal Thakur and Siddhant Chaturvedi, the film challenges idealised love and releases in February 2026.

Prime Video, Zee5, SonyLIV, JioHotstar: The RajaSaab, Parasakti and more Streaming platforms are rolling out a packed slate this week, featuring a blend of horror, crime, historical drama and coming-of-age stories.

Mandana Karimi on Iran unrest, lack of empathy: Don't explain my pain to me Mandana Karimi shared a heartfelt message about the emotional impact of the Iran unrest. She emphasised the vital role of women and called for empathy amid political backlash.

D55: Mammootty joins Dhanush in Rajkumar Periasamy directorial Malayalam superstar Mammootty has been confirmed as part of the cast for the Tamil film D55, alongside Dhanush, Sai Pallavi, and Sreeleela. The project, directed by Rajkumar Periasamy, marks Mammootty's return to Tamil cinema.

Netflix this week: Kohrra Season 2, Salvador, Lead Children and more Netflix is set to drop a packed slate of new releases this week, including Kohrra Season 2, The Lincoln Lawyer Season 4, and several gripping international titles.

Wuthering Heights first reviews out: Margot Robbie film called bodice-ripping hit First reviews for Emerald Fennell's Wuthering Heights are in, with critics praising the "scorching hot" chemistry between Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. The film is predicted to be a box office hit, describing it as a breathtaking, "bodice-ripping crowd-pleaser" that firmly establishes itself as a masterpiece.

Working with my life: Sidharth Malhotra, Kiara Advani spark new project buzz Actors Sidharth Malhotra and Kiara Advani, who previously starred together in Shershaah and are married in real life, are set to share the screen once again. The couple have teased their upcoming project with an adorable banter on social media.

general news.headline: Lok Sabha adjourned minutes before PM's speech. What exactly happenedSources said that after the House was adjourned, Congress and other opposition women MPs again moved towards the treasury benches, advancing up to two rows behind the Prime Minister's chair and heading in the direction of BJP MP Nishikant Dubey.

Sorry, papa: 3 girls die by suicide; K-culture obsession angle emergesThree sisters died after they allegedly jumped off the ninth floor of their residential building in Ghaziabad. Police sources ruled out the victims being addicted to a task-based Korean online gaming app and that they were influenced by Korean culture.

A book for a book: Nishikant Dubey's excerpts on Gandhis spark Priyanka's counterThe battle lines are now drawn. After Rahul Gandhi claimed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was compromised while attempting to cite from an unpublished book, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey on Wednesday hit back at the Congress, displaying a series of books which he said detailed decades of deception, betrayal, and corruption of the Nehru-Gandhi family.

Here's a traitor: Rahul Gandhi jabs aide-turned-BJP minister Ravneet Bittu outside ParliamentRahul Gandhi referred to former Congress MP Ravneet Singh Bittu as his "traitor friend," prompting a strong response from the BJP leader, who hit back by calling Gandhi a "desh ka dushman" (enemy of the nation).

Trampoline Trump puts Modi govt in a bind: Can neither boast, nor debunkPresident Donald Trump has put the Modi government in a spot by jumping to announce the finalisation of the India-US trade deal. He has exposed the government to attacks for at least the time it makes the deal details public.

Why India is fortifying Chicken's Neck with underground railThe Chicken's Neck, India's only land route to the northeast, has repeatedly been used as an intimidation tactic by China, and more recently, Bangladesh. India is now constructing underground railway tracks along the stretch. In this report, we explain why the move is important and the significance of its timing.

150 people dead in Bengal due to SIR pressure: Mamata Banerjee to Supreme CourtWhile presenting her arguments before the Supreme Court, Mamata Banerjee claimed that over 150 people had died due to the pressure of the exercise, including a Booth Level Officer who reportedly died due to severe stress due to directives from the Chief Electoral Officer.

Video: Teen help, abused for years, found hidden inside bed box in Guwahati homeThe accused allegedly hid the girl inside the divan's storage compartment for around 25 minutes after learning that an inspection was imminent. The occupants initially denied that the child was inside the house, claiming that her father had taken her away a few days earlier.

Layoffs chatter gets stronger as Claude AI threatens SaaS's core businessThis Wednesday is turning out to be a day of an earthquake in the Indian IT industry. The reason is Claude AI and how it is positioning itself as a SaaS killer. The result is that stocks of IT companies are down and there is already chatter around upcoming layoffs that may hit companies like Infosys and TCS.

Who is Y Khemchand Singh, BJP leader sworn in as Manipur CM?BJP leader Y Khemchand Singh was sworn in as the chief minister of Manipur, ending months of President's Rule and restoring an elected government in the state.

India was willing to wait out Trump term on trade dealThe Modi government had conveyed to the US in early September 2025 that it was willing to wait out the Trump presidential term if needed on the India-US trade deal. This tough line was conveyed to US Secretary of State Marco Rubio by India NSA Ajit Doval, according to a Bloomberg report. The report on the meeting and the mellowing down of Trump and his aides after that gives a new perspective to the debate over the India-US trade deal.

Baloch rebels better equipped than army: Why Pakistan is losing gripPakistan seems to be gradually losing its grip over the restive Balochistan region since Baloch rebels started carrying out coordinated attacks against security forces. Defence Minister Khawaja Asif admitted it in no uncertain terms.

Ghaziabad girls' suicide: Why self-harm games gain traction in KoreaA case in Ghaziabad, in which three sisters died by suicide, has revived concerns over self-harm linked to obsessive online trends and their perceived links to South Korea. While Korean culture has never promoted toxic fandoms and challenges, the country's high-stress environment provides fertile ground for their spread. The growing interest of Indians in Korean culture explains how these trends travel here.

Video: Massive 12-km jam on Mumbai-Pune Expressway, vehicles stuck for 18 hoursTraffic movement on the Mumbai–Pune Expressway was thrown into chaos for 18 hours after a gas tanker turned turtle, resulting in a massive jam extending more than 12 kilometres and leaving hundreds of vehicles stranded overnight.

Had to leave my marriage: Melinda Gates on Epstein files' STD claim against BillMelinda French Gates has responded to the latest batch of Jeffrey Epstein files that claimed her former husband and Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates caught STD after having sex with Russian girls and then tried to secretly give her medication for the disease.

North Indians are panipuri sellers, table cleaners: Row over DMK minister's remarkA DMK minister in Tamil Nadu courted controversy when he called the North Indians panipuri sellers, table cleaners and construction workers, sparking an outcry from the BJP.

Ram Charan, Upasana's cute gift hampers has cute message from daughter Klin KaaraRam Charan and Upasana gifted elephant-themed hampers marking the arrival of their twins. The hampers included a special message from their daughter Klin Kaara, highlighting family blessings and gratitude.

No AI, no job: Hiring norms are changing fast, say expertsJob interviews are changing in ways many candidates don't yet realise. Across sectors, employers are beginning to treat AI fluency as a basic professional skill, and not an optional extra. This feature explores how the question is no longer whether you can do the job but whether you can do it with AI.

Why Hugo Boss sees India as a key growth market amid global slowdownHugo Boss currently has around 15 stores in India and plans to double that number over the next two to three years. According to its CEO, the brand is being well received by both men and women in the country.

IND U19 vs AFG U19 live: Ayush Mhatre, Aaron George keep India's chase on trackIndia (IND) vs Afghanistan (AFG) Live Score, U19 World Cup 2026 semifinal: After a quickfire start to their chase thanks to Vaibhav Suryavanshi, Aaron George and Ayush Mhatre have stabilised the chase and are well on track to complete a record run chase.

Wuthering Heights first reviews out: Margot Robbie film called bodice-ripping hitFirst reviews for Emerald Fennell's Wuthering Heights are in, with critics praising the "scorching hot" chemistry between Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi. The film is predicted to be a box office hit, describing it as a breathtaking, "bodice-ripping crowd-pleaser" that firmly establishes itself as a masterpiece.

Why Anthropic's new AI tools rattled Wall Street's tech giants, hit Indian IT stocksThe slide in IT stocks is not just about prices. It reflects the new uncertainty AI brings to global tech. Knowing what sparked it helps decode what lies ahead for the sector.

Infosys, TCS shares tumble amid global tech sell-off: Is the AI fear justified?Was today's slide in IT stocks a glimpse of the future or just market overreaction? For investors, the only question now is whether the AI threat is real or simply rattling nerves.

Turkish Airlines flight with 236 onboard lands in Kolkata after engine fire scareA Turkish Airlines flight with 236 passengers made a full emergency landing at Kolkata airport after the captain reported a possible fire in the right engine.

sports.headline: U19 World Cup: Vaibhav steps up under pressure with 33-ball 68 in semi-final IND-U19 vs AFG-U19: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi delivered a fearless counterattack under pressure, smashing 68 off just 33 balls to give India a flying start in their chase against Afghanistan in the Under-19 World Cup 2026 semi-final at the Harare Sports Club on Wednesday.

IND vs SA warmups Live Score: India aim for fine-tuning against Proteas IND vs SA T20 World Cup Warm Up Match: After their 4-1 series win over New Zealand, Suryakumar Yadav's India will be looking to fine-tune their game against the Proteas in Navi Mumbai before they lock horns with the USA in their opening game.

Rohit, Kohli for ODI World Cup? Dhoni tells Agarkar to focus on fitness, not age Former India captain MS Dhoni has given his verdict that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should be considered for the ODI World Cup in 2027. Dhoni's viewers have found a lot of takers among fans.

Sachin Tendulkar rallies Mumbai with timely pep talk before Ranji Trophy quarterfinal Sachin Tendulkar shared insights on pressure and preparation with the Mumbai squad ahead of their Ranji Trophy quarterfinal against Karnataka, offering timely motivation before the knockout clash.

Inspired by Hardik Pandya, Bas de Leede aims for 'big man moments' in World Cup Netherlands beat South Africa in the ODI World Cup hosted in India back in 2023. As they return for yet another world tournament, all-rounder Bas de Leede hopes to inspire them to consistency in big events.

Ishan Kishan jumps 32 spots, Saim Ayub becomes No. 1 T20I all-rounder India's Ishan Kishan has climbed 32 places to No.32 in the latest ICC Men's T20I batter rankings following his performances in the home series against New Zealand. Meanwhile, Pakistan's Saim Ayub has moved to the top of the T20I all-rounder rankings.

MS Dhoni rules out commentary stint, reveals why he avoids using phone Former India captain MS Dhoni has all but ruled out a move to the commentary box, describing the popular post-retirement role as a demanding craft that requires a delicate balance and a sharp command of statistics, something he admits does not come naturally to him.

Pep Guardiola vows to speak up for victims of global conflicts ahead of World Cup Pep Guardiola made an impassioned plea to "protect human life" in an emotional news conference, during which the Manchester City head coach referenced the recent deaths of Renee Good and Alex Pretti in Minneapolis.

IND v SA, T20 World Cup warm-up: Now or never for Sanju Samson? IND vs SA, T20 World Cup warm-up match: Even champions have doubts to settle. India's warm-up against South Africa doubles as a selection trial, with Sanju Samson's opening spot under threat from the in-form Ishan Kishan this week.

IND U19 vs AFG U19 live: Ayush Mhatre looks to stamp authority India (IND) vs Afghanistan (AFG) Live Score, U19 World Cup 2026 semifinal: India have made a strong start in the chase thanks to Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's quick fifty. But now with his dismissal, the onus is on the captain, Ayush Mhatre and Aaron George to keep them in the hunt.

Boycott India, forget Super 8s: Why rain is Pakistan's biggest foe in Colombo T20 World Cup: Pakistan have decided to boycott their group stage match against India in Colombo. But can they afford to waste a game when two of their other matches are threatened by rain?

T20 World Cup: Pakistan can brag about series win, but don't count Australia outPakistan have every right to enjoy a 3-0 sweep of Australia so close to a T20 World Cup, but the context tempers the celebration. Australia travelled with a depleted squad and used the series as preparation, and history shows they have often stumbled before global tournaments, only to find their best form when it matters most.

Can India defend T20 World Cup? MS Dhoni gives his verdict on Suryakumar's teamMS Dhoni believes India are primed for a historic T20 World Cup title defence at home. The former captain, however, warns that dew and toss conditions could still decide crunch matches.

Pakistan being unfair to own players with India boycott: Kapil DevKapil Dev has warned Pakistan that boycotting India at the T20 World Cup will only hurt their own players. He says the ICC consequences will linger long after the headlines fade.

Carabao Cup: Arsenal boost treble hopes as Chelsea win books final spotArsenal edge past Chelsea to reach the Carabao Cup final and keep a multi-trophy season alive. With Wembley booked, Arteta's side quietly strengthen their treble hopes and keep the quadruple dream ticking.

U-19 World Cup: Invincible India take on resilient Afghanistan for a spot in the finalHaving stormed into the semi-finals without dropping a single game in the Under-19 World Cup 2026 so far, India will face the underdogs Afghanistan in the all-important clash. The Ayush Mhatre-led side will look to advance to the final without much trouble, to take on England in the summit clash.

England complete T20 series sweep vs Sri Lanka to cap ideal World Cup build-upEngland completed a 3-0 T20I series sweep over Sri Lanka with a 12-run victory in the third and final match at Pallekele, rounding off their preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup on a high.

Gautam Gambhir ignores question on Pakistan's T20 World Cup boycott vs IndiaIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir refused to comment on Pakistan's boycott stance against India ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. Pakistan government has denied permission to its cricket team to play against India in the tournament.

Pakistan will backtrack on India boycott stance in 4-5 days: Former India spinnerRavichandran Ashwin believes Pakistan will reverse its decision not to play India in the T20 World Cup 2026. The ICC has warned PCB of serious consequences if they choose to move ahead with their stance of not playing against the arch-rivals on February 15 in Colombo.

Dominant Delhi Capitals rout Gujarat Giants to set up final against RCBWomen's Premier League Eliminator: Delhi Capitals crushed Gujarat Giants by seven wickets to reach their fourth consecutive WPL final, setting up a high-stakes showdown against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Snubbed from IPL, T20 World Cup, Steve Smith finds a taker in PSLAfter going unsold at the Indian Premier League 2026 auction, Australia great Steve Smith has been signed by Sialkot Stallionz for the 11th season of the Pakistan Super League.

Try banning Pakistan: Ex-Pak cricketer challenges ICC over India match boycottT20 World Cup 2026: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali criticised the International Cricket Council, daring it to take punitive action against Pakistan if the team forfeits its match against India on February 15. Ali argued that the Pakistan Cricket Board, acting on government directives, cannot be penalised by the global cricket body.

Thomas Rew's hundred powers England past Australia into finalCaptain Thomas Rew struck a battling century as England sealed their place in Friday's Under-19 World Cup final with a 27-run victory over Australia in the first semi-final.

Please don't do this: When Ponting couldn't convince Delhi to retain T20 starFormer Australian captain Ricky Ponting said that in 2018, during his time with Abhishek Sharma at Delhi Capitals in the IPL, he urged the franchise's owners to retain the young batter and not let him go.

Fresh trouble for Pakistan: Broadcasters may sue PCB over India match boycottT20 World Cup 2026: More trouble is brewing for Pakistan. Beyond the threat of severe sanctions from the International Cricket Council, the tournament's broadcaster may take legal action against the Pakistan Cricket Board if the senior national team boycotts the February 15 match against India.

New MCC laws explained: 10 rule changes coming to cricket in October 2026The Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) has announced 10 major rule changes that will reshape how the game is played, with the new laws coming into effect on 1 October 2026.

GG vs DC Eliminator Highlights: Delhi storm into 4th successive final with 7-wicket winGujarat Giants (GG) vs Delhi Capitals (DC) Live score, WPL 2026 Eliminator: Delhi Capitals have qualified for their fourth successive Women's Premier League final with a seven-wicket victory over Gujarat Giants in the Eliminator in Vadodara.

Gold medal for chaos: Cricket a glorious mess before much-awaited Olympics returnThe T20 World Cup 2026, featuring 20 teams, was meant to showcase cricket's global future. Instead, it has revived old habits, dragging the sport back into familiar, self-made chaos. With two years to go before cricket's Olympic return, the ICC needs to set its house in order.

Alcaraz was like baby Nadal: Ex-tennis player recalls incredible storyThe Australian Open champion, Carlos Alcaraz, was just 14 when he first left a seasoned top-10 professional searching for answers. More than a decade later, Spain's Davis Cup captain David Ferrer believes that fleeting practice-court moment already carried unmistakable shades of a young Rafael Nadal.

Pakistan shouldn't play vs India, was ICC sleeping before? Former cricketerFormer Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal supports PCB's decision to boycott the India match in the T20 World Cup 2026, citing ICC's biased approach. Pakistan's government has denied permission to its cricket team to play against India in the tournament.

Gavaskar trolls Pakistan over T20 World Cup stand: Waiting for their U-turnT20 World Cup: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar has trolled Pakistan over their stand of boycotting India in the T20 World Cup 2026. Gavaskar said that he is awaiting a U-turn that Pakistani players are infamously known for.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
